required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of TENS Therapy Following Arthroscopic Knee Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Transcutaneous Electrical Nerve Stimulation (TENS) on Postoperative Pain and Function Following Arthroscopic Knee Surgery: A Prospective Randomized Clinical Trial Pilot Study

lead_sponsor.agency: A.T. Still University of Health Sciences

clinical_study.source: A.T. Still University of Health Sciences

brief_summary.textblock: Following standard of care procedures for arthroscopy knee surgery it is anticipated that Transcutaneous Electrical Nerve Stimulation (TENS) will provide improved pain relief and improve functional outcomes.

primary_outcome.measure: Patient's Perception of Pain in the Early Post-operative Period While Utilizing Structured TENS Therapy.
primary_outcome.description: The patient participant will record pain levels during the immediate post-op 2-week time period every day. Day 0 is pain level before surgery. Pain perception measured on a scale from 0-10 with 0 representing no or lowest level pain and 10 representing the highest level of pain

arm_group.description: This group will be given an active TENS unit to use.
This group will receive a placebo TENS unit which has been functionally disabled to provide a short initial electrical impulse then cease delivering that impulse.

intervention.intervention_name: TENS Treatment with functional or disabled unit
intervention.description: TENS treatment will be standardized and will consist of 20 minute sessions three times per day at the manufacturer's recommended settings for both functional and disabled TENS units.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 18-60
- BMI<50
- No significant joint malalignment
- No significant ligamentous instability
- No significant radiographic joint space narrowing
- No prior significant knee surgery
- Unilateral knee surgery
- Not workman's compensation
- Planned knee arthroscopy for meniscectomy, chondroplasty or synovectomy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age <18 or >60
- BMI > 50
- Significant joint malalignment
- Significant ligamentous instability
- Significant radiographic joint space narrowing
- Prior significant knee surgery
- Bilateral knee surgery planned
- Worker's Compensation
- No planned knee arthroscopy for menisectomy, chondroplasty or synovectomy

facility.name: North Missouri Sports Medicine and Orthopaedic Surgery

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: Structured TENS Therapy
group.description: This group will be given an active TENS unit to use. TENS Treatment with functional or disabled unit: TENS treatment will be standardized and will consist of 20 minute sessions three times per day at the manufacturer's recommended settings for both functional and disabled TENS units.

group.title: Sham TENS Therapy
group.description: This group will receive a placebo TENS unit which has been functionally disabled to provide a short initial electrical impulse then cease delivering that impulse. TENS Treatment with functional or disabled unit: TENS treatment will be standardized and will consist of 20 minute sessions three times per day at the manufacturer's recommended settings for both functional and disabled TENS units.

outcome.description: The patient participant will record pain levels during the immediate post-op 2-week time period every day. Day 0 is pain level before surgery. Pain perception measured on a scale from 0-10 with 0 representing no or lowest level pain and 10 representing the highest level of pain

reported_events.desc: Transcutaneous Electrical Nerve Stimulation (TENS) therapy is considered an appropriate non-pharmacologic adjunct for the treatment of symptomatic knee arthritis. Since the electrical stimulation applied is minimal, the participants were at no risk of adverse events.

group.title: Structured TENS Therapy
group.description: This group will be given an active TENS unit to use. TENS Treatment with functional or disabled unit: TENS treatment will be standardized and will consist of 20 minute sessions three times per day at the manufacturer's recommended settings for both functional and disabled TENS units.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
